text: Acacia College (2010-2012) was an Australian co-educational school located in Mernda, Victoria. The school was owned by the Uniting Church. Acacia College opened in January 2010 in one of Melbourne's new residential areas. Information sessions were held in the year before opening and interest in places at the school was strong. New School On 17 October 2012, the school announced that it would be closing on 14 December because its owners, the Uniting Church, had found the school was not financially viable.http://www.theage.com.au/victoria/parents-in-shock-as-news- spreads-20121018-27sfd.html The site was sold and has become a second campus of Gilson College. == References == Category:Educational institutions established in 2010 Category:Private secondary schools in Victoria (Australia) Category:Uniting Church schools in Australia Category:2010 establishments in Australia Category:Educational institutions disestablished in 2012 Category:2012 disestablishments in Australia Category:Defunct schools in Victoria (Australia)
title: Acacia College
